marketNews.title: HGBT Incentives Officially Continued
marketNews.content: The government has officially continued the specific natural gas price incentive (HGBT) through the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Decree which was announced last week. Compared to the previous regulation, the extension of the HGBT incentive sets the gas price (plant gate) from the range of 6-7 US dollars per MMBTU to 6.5-7 US dollars per MMBTU. This price will be retroactive starting from January 2025, with a validity period of 5 years. HGBT will still be granted to the 7 recipient industrial sectors as per the previous regulation, namely ceramics, fertilizer, petrochemicals, oleochemicals, steel, glass, and rubber gloves. The Chairman of the Association of Indonesian Ceramic Industries (Asaki), Edy Suryanto, stated that the extension of HGBT is needed to maintain and increase the competitiveness of the domestic ceramic industry, and to provide business certainty and a conducive investment climate. Edy explained that the HGBT incentive in 2020-2024 has encouraged the addition of new national ceramic tile production capacity by 90 million square meters, foreign direct investment ranging from 20-23 trillion rupiah, and the absorption of approximately 15,000 new workers. Following the continuation of the HGBT incentive, Edy explained that Asaki members will immediately increase ceramic tile production capacity by 45 million square meters per year through an investment worth 4 trillion rupiah which is expected to absorb 5,000 new workers. This expansion is targeted for completion at least in 2H26. Although Asaki does not object to the increase in the HGBT tariff, Edy mentioned that they requested the incentive to be fully implemented on the ground, with gas supply having to match the industry's needs listed in the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Decree. Previously, Edy mentioned that Perusahaan Gas Negara increased the surcharge or additional fee for gas usage above the certain industrial gas allocation (AGIT) from 13.85 US dollars per MMBTU to 16.77 US dollars per MMBTU from January 1 to March 31, 2025. Edy revealed that if this surcharge were implemented, the objective of HGBT to increase the competitiveness of the manufacturing industry and support economic growth would not be realized.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway: HGBT Continuation
marketNews.content: We are of the view that the continuation of the HGBT incentive will provide positive sentiment for issuers sensitive to gas prices, especially Arwana Citramulia ($ARNA), because: - The extension of the HGBT incentive ensures ARNA can still access cheaper gas, considering energy costs contributed approximately 32% of the company's production costs in 2024. - The new price in the 2025 HGBT incentive is retroactive as of January 1, 2025, so ARNA will not pay for gas based on more expensive market prices during January-February 2025. - Based on our estimation, the increase in the HGBT tariff will only cause ARNA's gas costs to rise by about +10%, while ARNA only needs to increase its average selling price by about +2% to cover this gas price increase, which we believe will not be difficult, especially following the regulation on ceramic anti-dumping import duties (BMAD). The extension of the HGBT incentive with a moderate price increase provides certainty and stability to ARNA's production costs. We see that with the continuation of the HGBT incentive, ARNA will still be able to achieve double-digit growth in 2025 with net profit around 500 billion rupiah (more than +17% YoY). With this projected double-digit net profit growth, ARNA is currently traded at a valuation of <10x FY25 P/E and a dividend yield of around 6-7%, which we consider quite attractive.

marketNews.title: BPS recorded that the Consumer Price Index (CPI) in Indonesia experienced a deflation of 0.09% YoY in February 2025
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that the consumer price index (CPI) in Indonesia experienced a deflation of 0.09% YoY in February 2025 (vs. Jan 2025: 0.76% YoY inflation), outside consensus expectations which projected 0.41% YoY inflation and marking the first annual deflation since March 2000. This result was influenced by the electricity tariff discount of 50% since January 2025, with electricity tariffs contributing to deflation by 2.16 percentage points. On a monthly basis, Indonesia experienced a deflation of 0.48% MoM (vs. Jan 2025: 0.76% MoM deflation), outside consensus expectations which projected 0.02% MoM inflation, while also marking the second consecutive monthly deflation. On the other hand, core inflation rose to the highest level in the last 20 months at 2.48% YoY (vs. Jan 2025: 2.36% YoY inflation), exceeding consensus expectations at 2.45% YoY.

marketNews.title: OJK and BEI Agree to Postpone Short Selling and Review Buyback Policy
marketNews.content: The Deputy Commissioner for Capital Market Investment Supervision and Securities Entities of OJK, Aditya Jayaantara, stated on Monday (3/3) that OJK and BEI agreed to postpone the implementation of short selling and to review the policy so that issuers can conduct share buybacks without AGM approval. These steps are aimed at reducing pressure on the IHSG which had dropped -3.31% on Friday (28/2) and had weakened -7.91% YTD as of Monday (3/3). Previously, BEI planned to release the first stage of short selling in March 2025.

marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump stated that 5 cryptocurrencies will be included in the US strategic cryptocurrency reserve
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, stated on Sunday (2/3) that 5 cryptocurrencies will be included in the US strategic cryptocurrency reserve, namely Bitcoin, Ethereum, XRP, Solana, and Cardano.

marketNews.title: S&P Global noted that Indonesia's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 53.6 in February 2025
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that the manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) for Indonesia rose to 53.6 in February 2025 (vs. Jan 2025: 51.9), marking the expansion of factory activity for 3 consecutive months, which is also the fastest pace since March 2024. This result was driven by the highest growth in new orders in almost the last 1 year, amid increases in output, purchases, and employment.

marketNews.title: S&P Global noted that China's manufacturing PMI rose to 50.8 in February 2025
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that the manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) for China rose to 50.8 in February 2025 (vs. Jan 2025: 50.1), exceeding the consensus expectation of 50.3. This result marked the highest increase since November 2024, with output and new orders growing the highest in the last 3 months as market conditions improved.

marketNews.title: The Government Officially Sets the Coal Reference Price (HBA) as the Reference Price for Coal Exports as of March 1, 2025
marketNews.content: The government officially set the Coal Reference Price (HBA) as the reference price for coal exports as of March 1, 2025, based on the latest Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Decree. The Acting Executive Director of the Indonesian Coal Mining Association, Gita Mahyarani, stated that the regulation stipulates that the coal export price below the Coal Reference Price (HPB) will be rejected in the state revenue system, thus not receiving an export permit.

marketNews.title: Kontan reported that the total transaction during IIMS 2025 increased by 19% to IDR 8 Trillion
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the Indonesia International Motor Show (IIMS) 2025, held on February 13-23, 2025, at JIExpo, Kemayoran, recorded total transactions of 8 trillion rupiah (+19% YoY) with visitor numbers increasing by +3% YoY to 579,337 people. The number of vehicles sold during the event reached 22,322 units (+16.3% YoY), with the possibility of more additions as the recapitulation process for several brands is still ongoing. However, electric motorcycle sales at the exhibition decreased by -21% YoY due to a reduction in the number of exhibitors in that category and the non-operation of electric motorcycle policy stimulus during the exhibition period.

marketNews.title: SRIL Curator looking to lease assets to potential investors
marketNews.content: The Curator of Sri Rejeki Isman ($SRIL), Nurma Sadikin, stated on Monday (3/3) that the company is negotiating with potential investors to take over assets under a lease scheme. This step is intended to increase the bankruptcy assets and prevent their value from falling, as well as create opportunities for approximately 10,000 SRIL workers to be re-employed. Nurma explained that SRIL has communicated with several investors and will decide within 2 weeks regarding who will lease the assets. Previously, SRIL ceased operations as of March 1, 2025, after failing in its appeal against the bankruptcy ruling.

marketNews.title: Delta Dunia Makmur ($DOID) changes name to BUMA International Grup
marketNews.content: Delta Dunia Makmur ($DOID) announced a name change to BUMA International Grup. The President Director of DOID, Ronald Sutardja, stated that the name change strengthens the reputation of the company's subsidiary, PT Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama, as one of the leading mining contractors in Indonesia and abroad.

tickerNews.title: Indo Tambangraya Megah ($ITMG) Targets Sales Volume Growth of +10-14% YoY in 2025
tickerNews.content: - $ITMG: Indo Tambangraya Megah announced in an analyst meeting on Monday (3/3) that the company targets coal sales volume of approximately 26.3-27.4 million tons in 2025, which is higher by +9.6-14.2% YoY compared to 2024 realization. The coal production volume target for 2025 is set in the range of 20.8-21.9 million tons (+3-8.4% YoY), with a stripping ratio target in the range of 10-11x (vs. FY24: 10x). To achieve this target, ITMG allocates capex of approximately 50-65 million US dollars in 2025 (vs. 2024: 58 million US dollars).

tickerNews.title: Astra International ($ASII) Starts Plant Expansion in Karawang
tickerNews.content: - $ASII: Astra International through its business entity, PT Astra Daihatsu Motor, began plant expansion in Karawang with an investment value of 2.9 trillion rupiah. The expansion of the plant will increase the production capacity of PT Astra Daihatsu Motor by 140,000 units per year to 530,000 units per year, intended for domestic and global markets. The additional plant will produce LCGC models, namely Daihatsu Ayla and Toyota Agya.

tickerNews.title: Mayora Indah ($MYOR) Recorded Net Profit of IDR 985 Billion in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: - $MYOR: Mayora Indah recorded a net profit of 985 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-16% YoY, +231% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 3 trillion rupiah (-6% YoY), relatively in line with expectations as it achieved 98% of the consensus estimate. This result was supported by a surge in revenue in 4Q24 to 10.4 trillion rupiah (+21% YoY, +11% QoQ) along with the addition of production capacity from the new plant, bringing total revenue for 2024 to 36.1 trillion rupiah (+15% YoY). The gross profit margin in 4Q24 slightly improved quarter-on-quarter to 20.9% (vs. 4Q23: 26.7%, 3Q24: 20.5%) due to the continuation of price increases executed in October 2024 and the renewed strengthening of the US dollar exchange rate against the rupiah. The normalization of opex following the opening of 2 new plants in 3Q24 also contributed to the quarterly operating profit recovery to 1.18 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (-22% YoY, +63% QoQ). MYOR also recorded an exchange rate gain of 233 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 47 billion rupiah, 3Q24: loss of 257 billion rupiah), along with the renewed strengthening of the US dollar exchange rate against the rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Chandra Asri Pacific ($TPIA) Subsidiary Signs Term Loan Facility with Bank Danamon Indonesia ($BDMN)
tickerNews.content: - $TPIA: Chandra Asri Pacific through its infrastructure subsidiary, PT Chandra Daya Investasi, signed a term loan facility agreement worth 2 trillion rupiah from Bank Danamon Indonesia ($BDMN) with a tenor of 7 years. This facility can be allocated for green asset projects, such as renewable energy, sustainable water and wastewater management, energy efficiency, and others.

tickerNews.title: Avia Avian ($AVIA) Plans Second Share Buyback Program
tickerNews.content: - $AVIA: Avia Avian plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 1.42 billion (2.3%) shares with a maximum fund allocation of 1 trillion rupiah. The corporate action is scheduled to take place no later than 12 months after approval at the EGM/MLB to be held on April 10, 2025. This is the second share buyback program conducted by AVIA. Previously, the company announced a share buyback of 1.42 billion (2.3%) shares since the end of 2023, with a realization reaching 1.35 billion (2.2%) shares as of January 2025.

tickerNews.title: Green Power Group Controller Increases Stake in $LABA
tickerNews.content: - $LABA: The controller of Green Power Group, PT Nev Stored Energy, purchased 3.95 million LABA shares at an average price of 255 rupiah per share on February 28, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Nev Stored Energy in LABA increased from 50.75% to 51.11%.

tickerNews.title: Solusi Sinergi Digital ($WIFI) Collaborates with Era Media Sejahtera ($DOOH) for Cheap Internet Service Marketing
tickerNews.content: - $WIFI: Solusi Sinergi Digital announced a cooperation with Era Media Sejahtera ($DOOH) to market the company's 'Internet Rakyat' service. In this non-disclosed value cooperation, DOOH will expand the marketing of the 'Internet Rakyat' service by utilizing key opinion leaders, programmatic advertising, up to social media connected with communities and events.

tickerNews.title: MNC Asia Holding ($BHIT) Controller Increases Stake in $KPIG
tickerNews.content: - $KPIG: The controller of MNC Land, MNC Asia Holding ($BHIT), purchased 15 million KPIG shares at an average price of 137 rupiah per share on February 7, 24, and 25, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of BHIT in KPIG increased from 21.33% to 21.35%.

tickerNews.title: Topindo Solusi Komunika ($TOSK) Shareholder Increases Stake
tickerNews.content: - $TOSK: The shareholder of Topindo Solusi Komunika, Robi Cahyadi, purchased 107.5 million TOSK shares at a price of 50 rupiah per share on February 24-25, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 5.4 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Robi's ownership in TOSK increased from 3.87% to 6.33%.
